data.1-connect-button#1. Connect Button: This serves as the entry button to connect a wallet. When clicked, it opens either the Welcome Modal if no wallet is detected or the Select Modal if any wallet is detected. After wallet connection, the button displays the connected account address truncated for the UI (i.e., B62qo7...F5dJSu). Clicking the connected button will present the Dropdown Menu for further options.
data.2-welcome-modal#2. Welcome Modal: Displayed when no wallet is detected, the Welcome Modal presents a redirect button to the Mina Protocol official guide page for installing wallets and a configurable list of links to the websites of popular Mina wallets.
data.3-select-modal#3. Select Modal: This is shown when at least one wallet is detected as installed. It displays a button list of wallets supported by the zkApp. Detected wallets are sorted to the top of the list for easy access. Click any of the wallets in the list to trigger a connection flow.
data.4-context-menu#4. Context Menu: Available after a wallet is connected, this dropdown contains menu options to copy the connected wallet address to the clipboard, connect to another wallet, and disconnect.

data: There are two possible options to quickly add the Mina Wallet Adapter to your zkApps.
data.option-1-starter-kits#Option 1: Starter-:
The easiest way to start using the Mina Wallet Adapter is to build upon the starter-kit projects. There are starter-kits for various JavaScript frameworks; choose any compatible with your zkApp.
npx degit mina-wallet-adapter/starter-kit-react my-zkapp
cd my-zkapp
npx degit mina-wallet-adapter/starter-kit-svelte my-zkapp
cd my-zkapp
data.option-2-manual-installation#Option 2: M: Manually add the Mina Wallet Adapter to your pre-existing zkApp project.
data.add-dependency#Add dependency:
Install the following dependency in your project. Only a single package is required.
npm install @mina-wallet-adapter/ui-react
pnpm add @mina-wallet-adapter/ui-react
yarn add @mina-wallet-adapter/ui-react
bun add @mina-wallet-adapter/ui-react
data.thats-it#That's it: You can now start adding the useWallet hook for more advanced features.
data.add-dependency-1#Add dependency:

npm install @mina-wallet-adapter/ui-svelte

data.use-in-app-1#Use in App:
Use WalletProvider to set up the necessary context and common configurations.
The WalletMultiButton shows the user a button to connect and a modal to select available wallets from. It automatically uses the connection state to display appropriate components.
  <WalletProvider />
  <WalletMultiButton />
  <YourApp />
data.thats-it-1#That's it: You can now start adding the walletStore store for more advanced features.

data: List of wallets and zkApp projects supporting or supported by Mina Wallet Adapter.

The Mina Wallet Adapter offers a toolkit for integrating wallet support into zkApps. It comprises modular components and hooks designed for zkApps to seamlessly interact with all major wallets in the Mina Protocol ecosystem. This adapter provides reusable interfaces that facilitate interoperability between zkApps and wallets.Written in TypeScript, the Mina Wallet Adapter enables adding wallet support to zkApps with just a few lines of code.
data.core-features#Core Features:
Auto-detection of installed wallets
Automatic wallet state management
Query hooks and modular UI components for zkApps
Wallet Standard support
Written in TypeScript with support for multiple JS frameworks like React, Svelte, and more
data.roadmap-features#Roadmap Features:
The following features are planned and coming soon.
Mina Wallet Provider APIs (RFC-0008, RFC-0009 and RFC-0010) compatibility
Integration with the .mina domain (Mina Names Service)
Customizable UI with light and dark modes, and themable styles
